intro: Vernonia huairacajana, commonly known as the Huairacaja Vernonia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, adapting to arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk, attracting various pollinators. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological role and potential horticultural value.
